name: Gosford Pines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for accommodation near Escot Park for an event we were taking part in. Quick search on the internet and found this guest house practically across the road. Great communication from the hosts to book which is reassuring. Finding it in the dark, pouring rain up and down country lanes was a bit tricky, as we decided not to follow the instructions on the web site ?? When we eventually used the instructions provided on the web site it was easy :) Lesson learned!
reviews.title: A Great English country guest house
Not to be missed
reviews.text: Judy noticed us arriving and came out to welcome us. The house is lovely very old farm house it was warm and welcoming, I think Judy said it goes back to the 1700's. So if your looking for pristine, plastic and modern this is not the place for you.

The twin room we had was HUGE you don't get that from the picture apparently all 3 guest rooms are pretty big. I believe the twin is the best for the size and the view, although I think Judy mentioned that it is a King size bed in the double so you wont be squeezed in. Great tea and coffee making facilities with fresh milk in a flask which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: HIDDEN GEM

aka: Gosford Pines Ottery St. Mary, Devon
